intro: Castela galapageia f. jacobensis, commonly known as the Jacob's castela, is a rare and endemic plant species found primarily in the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, thriving in sandy or rocky soils with high salinity. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
